title: Unity and Christian Conduct
shortSummary: Ephesians 4 emphasizes the call for believers to live in unity and maturity, reflecting their new identity in Christ. Paul urges the church to embrace humility, love, and spiritual gifts for building up the body of Christ, while putting off the old sinful nature and putting on righteousness.
timeline: c. AD 60 - Paul's imprisonment in Rome, during which he wrote the Epistle to the Ephesians

keyCharacters.name: Paul
keyCharacters.description: The apostle and author of Ephesians, writing as a prisoner of the Lord to instruct believers on Christian unity and conduct.

keyCharacters.name: Christ
keyCharacters.description: The head of the church who gives spiritual gifts and calls believers to maturity and unity.

definitions.definition: Humility or modesty in attitude, recognizing one's dependence on God and others.
Patience and endurance under provocation or suffering without resentment.
A biblical term referring to the believer's former sinful nature before salvation.
The renewed nature of a believer, created after God in righteousness and holiness.
The spiritual bond and harmony among believers, maintained by the Holy Spirit.

outline.heading: Exhortation to Walk Worthy and Maintain Unity
outline.description: Paul appeals to believers to live a life worthy of their calling by practicing humility, patience, and love, emphasizing the unity of the Spirit through one body, one Spirit, one hope, one Lord, one faith, one baptism, and one God.

outline.heading: Spiritual Gifts for Building the Church
outline.description: Christ gives various gifts such as apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors, and teachers to equip the saints for ministry and to build up the body of Christ toward unity and maturity in faith.

outline.heading: Call to Christian Maturity and Separation from Former Ways
outline.description: Believers are urged to abandon their former sinful lifestyle and be renewed in the spirit of their minds, putting on the new man created in righteousness and holiness.

outline.heading: Practical Instructions for Holy Living
outline.description: Paul provides specific commands for righteous living, including speaking truth, controlling anger, honest labor, wholesome speech, grieving not the Holy Spirit, and practicing kindness and forgiveness.

application: Pursue unity in the church by demonstrating humility, patience, and love toward fellow believers.
Use your God-given spiritual gifts to serve others and help the church grow in maturity.
Reject former sinful habits and renew your mind daily through Scripture and prayer.
Practice truthful, kind, and forgiving speech to reflect Christ’s love in your relationships.

keyVerses.text: I therefore, the prisoner of the Lord, beseech you that ye walk worthy of the vocation wherewith ye are called,
keyVerses.significance: This verse sets the tone for the chapter, urging believers to live in a manner worthy of their divine calling.

keyVerses.text: Till we all come in the unity of the faith, and of the knowledge of the Son of God, unto a perfect man, unto the measure of the stature of the fulness of Christ:
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the goal of Christian growth: unity and maturity in Christ.

keyVerses.text: That ye put off concerning the former conversation the old man, which is corrupt according to the deceitful lusts; And be renewed in the spirit of your mind; And that ye put on the new man, which after God is created in righteousness and true holiness.
keyVerses.significance: These verses describe the transformation expected of believers as they leave behind their old sinful nature and embrace a new life in Christ.

keyVerses.text: And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ's sake hath forgiven you.
keyVerses.significance: This verse encapsulates the Christian ethic of forgiveness and kindness modeled after God’s grace.
